meanings.sent1: The kitchen was so messy that you couldn't find anything.
meanings.sent2: Her room always looks messy with clothes strewn everywhere.
meanings.sent3: Trying to find a clean shirt in his messy closet was like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as messy as a tangled ball of yarn.
meanings.sent5: The muddy paw prints left a messy trail through the house.

meanings.sent1: The instructions were so messy that no one could follow them.
meanings.sent2: His handwriting was messy, making it hard to read his notes.
meanings.sent3: The messy jumble of wires behind the TV looked like a modern art piece.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were as messy as a stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The meeting ended in a messy disagreement with no clear resolution.

meanings.definition: In a state of confusion or disorder
meanings.sent1: The project became messy when everyone started working on different parts.
meanings.sent2: The party turned messy when the music suddenly stopped.
meanings.sent3: The messy mix-up of dates caused a lot of confusion.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship had become as messy as a tangled knot.
meanings.sent5: The situation quickly spiraled into a messy chaos.
